New Records: Florian Wirtz scored Germany's fastest international goal after seven seconds, breaking Lukas Podolski's previous record of 7 seconds set against Ecuador in 2013.
Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz scored Germany's fastest international goal after seven seconds.
Kylian Mbappé forced a fine save from Germany's Marc-André ter Stegen.
Germany doubled their lead early in the second half with Wirtz picking out Jamal Musiala with a cross and he cut back for Kai Havertz to finish the move.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann was desperate for a good start to the year ahead of the tournament on home soil in June and that is exactly what he got.
France coach Didier Deschamps expressed disappointment, stating 'The Germans played a high level match today. When we see our start to the match, with this goal, we are standing still.'
Post-Match Reflections: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann said, 'We had a very good start and the kickoff was planned exactly that way. It was important to protect the lead and after the break we improved further and carved out more chances. I am very satisfied with the way we fought. It is what we wish, to give it all every time.'
France coach Didier Deschamps added, 'The Germans did things better than us. In terms of commitment and aggression, we were below. The first person to blame is me.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: France pushed for an equaliser with Ousmane Dembélé and Adrien Rabiot but it was the Germans who scored again.
Germany defender Antonio Ruediger hit his own post as he tried to clear a ball in the second half.
